snippet: In Tunisia and other countries that toppled governments in the Arab Spring, new regimes are struggling to impose order on the chaos left behind.
abstract: Six-month-old Tunisian government cracks down on thousands of protesters who filled a central artery of the capital of Tunis in defiance of a new ban on demonstrations; the confrontation is another manifestation of the role reversal playing out across North Africa in the wake of the Arab Spring, with former exiles and political prisoners who spent careers under police state rule finding themselves struggling to impose order.

byline.contributor: Hend Hassassi contributed reporting from Tunis.

lead_paragraph: In Tunisia and other countries that toppled governments in the Arab Spring, new regimes are struggling to impose order on the chaos left behind.

headline.seo: Tunisia Cracks Down Again on Protesters Defying a Ban
headline.main: Tunisia Cracks Down Again on Protesters Defying a Ban
headline.print_headline: Tunisia Cracks Down Again on Protesters Defying a Ban
